key_metrics.name: GMS per Active Buyer
key_metrics.context: Trailing twelve month basis, down 1.6% year-over-year

guidance.commentary: Better than expected performance at both Etsy and Depop enabled us to exceed the top end of our consolidated GMS guidance range. Management expects Q4 GMS of $3.5-3.65B with take rate around 24.5% and adjusted EBITDA margin around 24%.

acquisitions.name: Reverb Sale
acquisitions.details: Completed sale of Reverb on June 2, 2025

partnerships.details: Enables U.S. ChatGPT users to discover and purchase items from U.S. sellers
partnerships.impact: Expanding marketplace reach through AI integration

product_launches.details: New in-app styling feature on Depop that lets users collage pieces and shop directly from their creations
product_launches.impact: Enhanced user engagement and shopping experience

initiatives.expected_impact: Retaining and rewarding most valuable customers

initiatives.progress: Increased investments in paid marketing activity

risks.details: External factors outside of company control
Level of demand in marketplaces may fluctuate

competitive_advantages: Unique and creative goods marketplace positioning
Established two-sided marketplace with network effects

key_positives: Exceeded expectations across all three key financial metrics
Strong services revenue growth of 12.7% year-over-year
Healthy gross margin of 71.3% and adjusted EBITDA margin of 25.3%
Strategic AI partnerships expanding market reach
key_concerns: GMS per active buyer down 1.6% on trailing twelve month basis
High debt levels relative to cash position

notable_quotes.speaker: Josh Silverman, CEO
notable_quotes.quote: Etsy's third quarter consolidated results surpassed expectations across all three of our key financial metrics.

notable_quotes.speaker: Lanny Baker, CFO
notable_quotes.quote: Third quarter consolidated GMS was $2.7 billion, up 0.9% year-over-year excluding Reverb from the prior-year period.

highlights.investment_thesis: Etsy delivered strong profitability with expanding margins despite modest GMV growth, driven by successful monetization improvements and AI-powered marketplace enhancements. The company's focus on unique creative goods and strategic partnerships positions it well for sustainable growth, though marketplace revenue headwinds and seller count declines warrant monitoring.

metadata.notes: Comprehensive financial and operational data available. Some cash flow metrics missing. Reverb divestiture impacts year-over-year comparisons. Strong qualitative strategic information provided.
